content.text: Colorectal cancer often begins as a growth called a polyp inside the colon or rectum. Finding and removing polyps can prevent colorectal cancer. Explore the links on this page to learn more about colorectal cancer prevention, screening, treatment, statistics, research, clinical trials, and more.
The information in this section is meant to help you cope with the many issues and concerns that occur when you have cancer.

National Cancer Institute
at the National Institutes of Health
